events.message: Customer reported an auto accident involving their vehicle at an intersection. They initiated the claim promptly following the incident.
The claim was categorized under 'Auto Accident' based on the report mentioning a car collision at the traffic junction.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the case, showing proactive response to the customer's auto accident claim.
The customer received official acknowledgment of the claim acceptance and was informed about next steps.
Requested supporting documents include photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and driver's license for the auto accident.
Customer submitted all requested documents timely, including accident photos and official police documentation.
Investigation began to review the circumstances of the collision and verify submitted documents related to the auto accident.
The investigation concluded that the customer's vehicle was at fault, based on collision evidence and witness statements.
A settlement amount was proposed to cover the vehicle repairs and related expenses from the auto accident claim.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt communication and clarity regarding the settlement offer provided.
The insurance company approved the auto accident claim following customer’s acceptance of the settlement terms.
Payment for the approved auto accident claim was issued to the customer’s bank account without delays.
The claim was officially closed after payment issuance and confirmation of customer satisfaction.
All case documents and communications were archived as part of the routine closure process for this auto accident claim.
